## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.




# Operaciones básicas 
Operaciones básicas de matemáticas lógicas y asignación

$$
\hat{x}=\frac{\sigma_{i=1}^{x_i}}{n}
$$

```{r} 
x = c(1:100)
x
```

```{r vector} 
xi = sum(x)/length(x)
xi
```
```{r vector} 
x = c(1:100)
xi = sum(x)/length(x)
xi
```

Vectores con datos ausentes
```{r}
x1 = c(1:10, NaN, 10:-20, NaN, 27)
x1i = sum(x1, na.rm = TRUE)/length(x1)
x1i
```

Cuando se coloca `na.rm =TRUE` entonces .....

# Manipulación de datos
Para la manipulación se utilizará la librería `tidyverse`

```{r tidy, echo = TRUE}
library(tidyverse); library(ggplot2)
#data("diamonds")

df= diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x=depth, y =price))+
df
 
df= diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x=depth, y =price, color=cut))+
  geom_point(size=0.2) + facet_wrap(cut~.)
df


df2= diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x=depth, y =price, color=cut))+
  geom_boxplot()+ geom_jitter(size=0.1, alpha=0.4)
df2
```
